intro: Cheilanthes hirta var. brevipilosa, commonly known as the short-hair spikemoss, is a member of the family Selaginellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern-like plant characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features short, hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It is often found in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments. This variety is notable for its resilience and ability to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
